Description

Copied over the description of the auto value from grid-template-rows and grid-template-columns into grid-auto-rows and grid-auto-columns

Motivation

The description in grid-template-rows and grid-template-columns is more descriptive as a whole and also adds details about the auto value when outside a minmax() function.
items.title: Update value descriptions in grid-auto-rows/columns

items.content_html:
Description

Document the restrictions for which requests are matched by DNR.

Motivation

It is important to know relevant restrictions that hides requests from the declarativeNetRequest extension API. The relevant restrictions are not clearly documented.

Additional details

  • initiator does not require host permissions for main_frame/sub_frame, https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1825824

  • Document restricted requests (system & restricted domains) (no bug).

  • Document restricted requests (about:-pages from browsers), https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1826651

  • Document restricted requests (other extensions), https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1810753

Related issues and pull requests

This PR references the "Restricted domains" section that is introduced in #26188
items.title: Document which requests are restricted in DNR

Description

As details of the new gecko_android sudkey in the android_specific_settings manifest key.

Also, removed the description of Microsoft Edge properties, which haven't been supported since it adopted Chromium, and remove the note about the safari subkey causing issues in Firefox 69 or earlier.

Motivation

Addresses the BCD requirements of Bug 1824237 Add support for new browser_specific_settings.gecko_android key.

Related issues and pull requests

Related BCD changes in PR #19363.
items.title: Addition of browser_specific_settings.gecko_android

items.content_html:
Description

  • use env var to hold build dir.
  • use --exclude param to skip copying *.map files to the build

Motivation

  1. We have use some hardcode var in many steps, it might be a bit hard to maintain. Use environment variables maybe a better idea (as the $BUILD_OUT_ROOT is not set before)
  2. Use --exclude param to skip copying *.map files, so we do not need to delete them after copying files.

Additional details

  • https://docs.github.com/en/actions/learn-github-actions/variables
  • https://linux.die.net/man/1/rsync
items.title: fix(pt-test): use env var to hold build dir

items.content_html:
Description

The Headers.getSetCookie() method has been added to Chrome 113. This PR adds a reference document for this new method.

This is a pretty straightforward addition. You can find other useful links in my research document.

One question I had — the Set-Cookie header page includes a note:

Warning: Browsers block frontend JavaScript code from accessing the Set-Cookie header, as required by the Fetch spec, which defines Set-Cookie as a forbidden response-header name that must be filtered out from any response exposed to frontend code.

This sounds contradictory to the purpose of getSetCookie() — has this note interpreted the spec correctly, and if so, should I update it to list getSetCookie() as an exception to this rule?

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fix #24266
items.title: add doc for Headers.getSetCookie()

items.title: DRAFT: PWA Tutorial 1

items.content_html:
Description

Removes example uses of reduce that are performance traps and less readable than alternatives.

Motivation

Example uses of a thing should be good uses. People who don’t know any better will use these examples in their projects and introduce serious performance bugs.

Additional details

  • The array flattening examples are better done with flat/flatMap.
  • Counting and grouping should be done with a simple loop.
  • Duplicate removal is better done with Set, as already noted.
  • Combined filter and map can be done with flatMap; calling reduce with repeated spread “more efficient” is wrong.
items.title: Remove bad-practice accidentally-quadratic examples from Array#reduce documentation

items.content_html:
Description

  • fixes #2670 by adding second argument expected to exportFunction in the example code.

  • also fixes a typo, and adds try...catch statements to prevent termination of code execution when expected errors are thrown in the same piece of example code

Motivation

Fixes various sections of the same example code that throws errors which cause termination of the example code:

  • The first fix addresses the initial reported issue by providing the second argument expected to the exportFunction function.

However, other parts of the same example code will throw errors and so were also addressed:

  • Permission denied error is thrown in the window.eval function when attempting access of properties of objA . So console.log(objA.foo) and objA.baz = "baz" were placed in separate try...catch statements to allow logging of the errors without code termination.
  • In the same window.eval function, fixed typo console.log(objA.foo) //undefined , since objA.foo will throw a permission denied error instead of returning undefined

The rest of the unaddressed example code segment outputs as documented since example is working within the context of content script / page script environments.

These changes will allow readers to run and examine the output of the entire example code without early code termination due to thrown errors.

Additional details

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Content_scripts#content_script_environment

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #2670
items.title: fix example error in "sharing objects with page scripts"
